People are asking why this needs permission for mic and photos. Mic is for 
the option to call or when you press the mic feature to record audio. The 
media permission is so you can send pictures saved on your phone to other 
people if you so choose to. I'm a conspiracy theorist but some of you are ...Full ReviewPeople are asking why this needs permission for mic and photos. Mic is for 
the option to call or when you press the mic feature to record audio. The 
media permission is so you can send pictures saved on your phone to other 
people if you so choose to. I'm a conspiracy theorist but some of you are 
just reaching or not thinking. Lol. Anyway, great app for free calling or 
messaging. Easy to use and it even has some fun games.

Asks for huge security and privacy holes to be opened up, then integrates 
with Facebook like it isn't a separate app. They update without so much as 
a mention of changing anything. It's nasty, but the Facebook app nags you 
to install it, so everyone on all platforms has it. Also, this is a giant ...Full ReviewAsks for huge security and privacy holes to be opened up, then integrates 
with Facebook like it isn't a separate app. They update without so much as 
a mention of changing anything. It's nasty, but the Facebook app nags you 
to install it, so everyone on all platforms has it. Also, this is a giant 
battery hog. Do yourself a huge favor and disable background data as soon 
as you install it!

This app has a lot more bugs than you would expect. Often times I have to 
force stop it and clear my cache data to get it to work again. by far the 
worst bug I think it has is when it does not properly terminate a call and 
my phone still thinks I am in a call even though I am not in a call in my ...Full ReviewThis app has a lot more bugs than you would expect. Often times I have to 
force stop it and clear my cache data to get it to work again. by far the 
worst bug I think it has is when it does not properly terminate a call and 
my phone still thinks I am in a call even though I am not in a call in my 
alarms do not ring at full volume because it is Trick my phone into 
thinking that I'm still in a call and I'm not in a call. It's really 
frustrating. And sometimes, for whatever reason it has the hardest time 
trying to connect to video calls whenever I've been using the app a lot in 
one day. the other thing I really don't like is that it will try to connect 
to my smart watch over Bluetooth as a audio device for a video call but 
then when that does not work it crashes the video call but because it 
defaults to Bluetooth, it always crashes a call. I have to then turn off 
Bluetooth on my phone start in connect the video call then turn bluetooth 
back on. It's really annoying.

...Full ReviewI installed this today and so far I am pleasantly surprised because it does

that. Also I would like the home screen [?] to default to the notifications 
list; it defaults to the messages history at the mo. And I use the Google 
handwriting input app which works with this 'Lite' app, but the input 
capture speed and accuracy both seem a bit reduced compared to some other 
apps. Of course being forced to write slower and do more like print than 
cursive, is probaby theraputic in my case so 5 stars is righteous.

Definitely one of the best apps of its kind that I've tried so far. It even has the best and loudest in-app video player I've seen in these kinds of app. That said, notifications are a bit delayed, which is why I always miss calls. I also still can't share links, photos, or videos from my newsfeed t...Full ReviewDefinitely one of the best apps of its kind that I've tried so far. It even has the best and loudest in-app video player I've seen in these kinds of app. That said, notifications are a bit delayed, which is why I always miss calls. I also still can't share links, photos, or videos from my newsfeed to labeled group chats. I'd have to tag each member one by one and even then, my post would still show up on a duplicate thread with our names as the default label instead of appearing on the already existing thread with the customized group name. Also, I wanna use night mode but it doesn't look too good in my opinion because of the design and colors used. Some stuff aren't even clearly visible. The notification light blinks too fast and too long in its current configuration as well. Lastly, I hope you make it faster and easier to switch accounts from the left side drawer, make it possible to more conveniently download photos in chat just by long-pressing the thumbnails instead of opening them one by one, and make a way for us to be able to download videos, especially from chat threads, not just the newsfeed. UPDATE: Working links/attachments posted by other people on chat threads don't appear anymore. I'm sure it's not because the links are dead or the attachments are unavailable/taken down already as I can see and open them just fine on Messenger Lite. That said, I checked the Facebook desktop site/view on my mobile browser (Chrome app) and I don't see the links/attachments either, while Facebook's mobile view on said browser doesn't let us view messages at all, as usual and forces us to install the app or switch to the desktop site. By the way, sometimes the bottom advertisements block the option/button to see all notifications. Closing them doesn't even work because that just replaces them with other targeted advertising.

I paid to remove ads. It's worth the price.  I like that I can configure it in ways the FB app can't. I got this mainly to allow me to use FB feed and Messenger messages in a single, clean, lightweight app that doesn't require me to restart my phone like Messenger did when I closed it.    Technically I could have left Messenger running before, but everything I did would crawl at a snail's pace (including typing) until I restarted my phone.  This app allows me to uninstall Messenger and still send/receive messages without issue now, with the added benefit of also browsing FB feed in the same GUI.

This app is essentially a bootleg Facebook on chrome browser - and it's lovely. Why? It's because it means it is a lightweight app. How much lighter? Messenger and Facebook combined is about 900mb, so let's round up to 1gb. Then, you have to take into account how ridiculous Facebook and messenger dr...Full ReviewThis app is essentially a bootleg Facebook on chrome browser - and it's lovely. Why? It's because it means it is a lightweight app. How much lighter? Messenger and Facebook combined is about 900mb, so let's round up to 1gb. Then, you have to take into account how ridiculous Facebook and messenger drain the battery and memory. This app starts at 20mb, and I'm currently at 69mb (storage increases as images, chat logs, etc. Go up. Aka cache.)  So, I highly recommend this app, this savior of our current decade while Facebook still exists.

three additional features I would want to see in the future would be: have 
the capability to allow my wife to have control over the children's 
accounts as well using her own Facebook, being able to remotely be aware 
that the...Full ReviewThe app itself functions well. The sound is a little dulled somehow. My 
three additional features I would want to see in the future would be: have 
the capability to allow my wife to have control over the children's 
accounts as well using her own Facebook, being able to remotely be aware 
that they are on it and possibly whom they are talking to, and finally 
being able to add someone who either has Facebook messenger and no account 
or someone whom I am not friends with for personal reasons. If in the 
future I see at least the last feature added, I will consider bumping this 
up to five stars.

The app is simple and easy to use, the design is classic for Google. It 
could use a few things in my opinion. 1. You can't set a limit for SMS or 
multimedia messages. 2. You can't lock messages at all. 3. You cannot 
change the size of the text. 4. No customization for the background. If 
none of ...Full ReviewThe app is simple and easy to use, the design is classic for Google. It 
could use a few things in my opinion. 1. You can't set a limit for SMS or 
multimedia messages. 2. You can't lock messages at all. 3. You cannot 
change the size of the text. 4. No customization for the background. If 
none of this bothers you then the app does very well, though I believe most 
Android users are very big on customizing their phones. It's the best part 
of having an Android.

I love dark mode on everything, and it's good to see Google finally (re-)embracing this, but let's be consistent please! Also, the quality of pics sent via MMS is very poor, and (as usual with Google apps) there are no advanced settings. I think the app is compressing the photos more than they need to be. Textra handles this a lot better.

Just coming back to messages to check out Messages For Web. The web

true, it ...Full ReviewJust coming back to messages to check out Messages For Web. The web 
implementation is a decent trick. Limited in possible scope, and I still 
wish Google would make an iMessage clone, but better than nothing. I've 
heard, but not tested, that I can only sync with one computer. If this is 
true, it needs to be expanded. There are two things I need in this app to 
make me feel good about using it as my primary sms app. First, a Dark 
theme. Second, a Chatheads implementation. A shameless clone of Facebook 
Messenger's implementation please. Otherwise the app looks and feels 
decent, and it's notifications feel better integrated with Android. Looking 
forward to RCS rollout.

Superb app from Google.Lives upto the mark. Very good control and

management of the app and this scores/grabs in many features. Whenever a 
OTP is received, it intelligently detects it and ask whether to copy it. 
This feature blew my mind, as of now, no messaging app does that, and I 
loved it. The major feature(which personally I felt the absence) that I 
missed in this application is, "user can't select multiple messages within 
a chat", i.e., if there are some 20 messages(separate-separate) in a chat 
and if I want to delete messages present at 2nd, 5th, 8th, 16th, 17th 
position, I simply cannot. I think with an update you can bring in that 
feature, other than that, the application is very good. Overall excellent!

I really don't know why some people are so critical of this app. I have a Pixel, so I already had this app on my phone, so I just stuck with it, and I don't regret it at all. It's got a beautiful design that lets you change the colors of each person's text bubbles, and now that there is a web app, I...Full ReviewI really don't know why some people are so critical of this app. I have a Pixel, so I already had this app on my phone, so I just stuck with it, and I don't regret it at all. It's got a beautiful design that lets you change the colors of each person's text bubbles, and now that there is a web app, I cannot be happier that I use this app. The web app works flawlessly, and is perfect for me since I can type way faster using a computer keyboard. Not only does the web app work flawlessly, but it's free, and has no ads. Sharing pictures is as easy as dragging and dropping files into the web app. I used to have an iPhone and Mac, and when I made the transition to a Pixel and PC, I missed being able to text from my computer. Don't have to worry about that anymore! And it's even better, because since it's a web app, I can easily text from any computer with an internet connection. 10/10.

I'm pleased that Google has finally implemented the ability to text from your computer. That said, I think there's a lot more that could be done with that.  If you are a Project Fi user using Hangouts as your texting app, your phone number is tied to your Gmail account. You will receive texts on you...Full ReviewI'm pleased that Google has finally implemented the ability to text from your computer. That said, I think there's a lot more that could be done with that.  If you are a Project Fi user using Hangouts as your texting app, your phone number is tied to your Gmail account. You will receive texts on your computer even if your phone is off, regardless of whether you've scanned a QR code. It's simply common sense that this should be the way it is here. It's easier and you don't have to rescan if you're the kind of person that clears cookies on your browser often. Furthermore, I will repeat what everyone in the Western World has been saying for some time now, there should be one unified Google Messaging app. Not five.

1 and SIM 2. I have selected SIM 1 as my default sim for sending SMS 
messages (it is an Android setting not Messages setting) and when ever I 
create a new message in Messages, it uses SIM 1 to send that message (that 
is, Messages uses my Android setting of default sim card). However, when 
someone send me SMS on SIM 2, now Messages uses SIM 2 as default to reply 
to that SMS which incurs me significant charges as I use only SIM 1 to send 
SMS. Please add an option to always reply through SIM 1 regardless of which 
sim received the message.

now things actually work.

I vowed to never give in to Messenger once they started forcing themselves 
down my throat through Facebook messages. That was until I switched from 
iOS to Android and found that the native messaging application was 
extremely limited. My messages take 5-10 min to show up which becomes 
especially ...Full ReviewI vowed to never give in to Messenger once they started forcing themselves 
down my throat through Facebook messages. That was until I switched from 
iOS to Android and found that the native messaging application was 
extremely limited. My messages take 5-10 min to show up which becomes 
especially frustrating when you're waiting on a temporary sign-in key. I'm 
sure my carrier has something to do with my speed of service but a "chat" 
function usually relies on cell data or wifi (which I'm on 90% of my life). 
I don't see this as an option with Android messages. I tried out the 
desktop sync and it's just a mirror of the phone app. Messenger isn't a 
perfect substitute either because it is too easy to get Facebook originated 
messages confused with your SMS and your notifications become useless. 
These are the options I have for default messaging on my Motorola G5. I've 
tried using other apps that aren't set to default but its not possible to 
completely ditch a native text app. Especially when your real phone number 
tied to a known device is required for verification purposes. Im tired of 
trying to explain Google voice to my mother and most other messaging apps 
require that the recipient also use the application. I think enabling a 
chat function would grow back a couple of stars.

Really not a fan of the notification sticking after quick reply. The point 
of notifications is to notify. Using quick reply acknowledges that I'm 
notified, and should dismiss the notification. If I want a whole 
conversation I'll open the app. There really should be a toggle to turn 
this off.

While I love the game and how you can change the size of the board and the background color, the fact that every time I closed out of the game or the screen timed out I would have to restart the level. I am uninstalling this game and going to try a different one. It was so very frustrating!

Would have given the game 5 stars. But I have reached a score of over 1 200 000 only to have it reset to a mere 25 000. And this is not the first time my score gets reset. I see a few other users have the same issue. I hope the developer will offer a solution sooner.

GAME RESETS I love playing this game and seeing if I can beat my high score. However, the game has reset several times recently while I'm playing.  I will put my phone down to do something (quickly, while leaving the screen on) and when I pick it back up, my game will be gone. It seems to happen since all of th...Full ReviewI love playing this game and seeing if I can beat my high score. However, the game has reset several times recently while I'm playing.  I will put my phone down to do something (quickly, while leaving the screen on) and when I pick it back up, my game will be gone. It seems to happen since all of the ads have been put on.

Love it. So relaxing & gets your mind off other things.    Only bad part, I Can't Lay IT down. Just one more  game seems to turn in several more. Got a high score in the 55000 s with 2 2048s . Enjoy  it much.

I love the game. I love being able to choose the board size and color scheme. The ads oft times crash the game. After finishing, it oft times freezes, so that I cannot start a new game until I restart my device. Those issues need to be addressed.

Love this game BUT Love this game but it automatically erases everything that you've done when I accidentally turn the phone sometimes to landscape. Very frustrating bcz I got a really good score. Other than that it would be 5*

Nice game, less Ads would be great! Sudden Video Ads pop up while you play the game. Otherwise nice game, attractive colours and UI. If Ads annoy you, take one without Ads otherwise this is a nice smooth app to use.
Too many bugs. When you minimize the game freezes at times. Couldn't continue with one of my games when reaching 2048. Otherwise, the app is great.
Haven't  had any issues. Don't  like the ads but I  know they are necessary to help pay for costs. Great game to pass the time, lots of fun!
Very Buggy This is a great version of the game, but constant ads and loss of progress are very frustrating. Its to bad there isn't a pro version with save.
Amazing Really good and fun but u can only go back once but it's not that big of a deal. I love it though and is really addictive. You can change the colour as well which is cool
This shiz is badass I can not stop playing this game. My family is starving and i can't PUT IT DOWN
Colorful and relaxing I love it that the tiles come in different colors. The interface feels smooth and fast. At times a little too fast but it's still better than similar games that lag.

Amazing customer service & game! Not only is the game made extremely well. It has many incredible aspects like creating your own background and tile colors. Incredible game and incredible customer service. 5 stars without a doubt!

A very good game to keep you occupied It's perfect for when you have 2-3 minutes to waste waiting for someone. I've been playing it for over 6 months on the 6x6 board and I got to the 272k tile. It gets a bit mo...Full ReviewIt's perfect for when you have 2-3 minutes to waste waiting for someone. Trouble is that when playing on the big boards it will take a very long time before the game gets challenging. Like... Months. I've been playing it for over 6 months on the 6x6 board and I got to the 272k tile. It gets a bit more interesting just before you combine everything, but after that it's clear sailing again. Still, like I said, great game to burn a bit of time. And the new undo update is perfect!

Love this game! I call this the forever game. Playing against bf so he's just as addicted as I am. It's amazing how many others also pla...Full ReviewLove this game! I call this the forever game. It's great for when you have downtime, while standing in lines, waiting for people, etc. I have been playing for over a year now and just got the 16 million block. People will regularly comment on the where they are in the game when they see us playing.

Whether that is attractive to you or not is a matter of personal preference, but I am a persistent guy.  My current score is 19,747,888 and last night I created a 1,048,576 tile.  The game works reliably, you can back up and restore games, and it has skins that change the game to chemical elements and letters of the alphabet to provide an interesting twist.

Plus Does Not Mean Harder As a fan of 2048, I was immediately drawn to 2048 plus as soon as I saw it. I was hoping for a more challenging twist on the game. Unfortunately that is not the case. 2048 Plus has a 6x6 grid instead of 4x4, but is otherwise the same. The larger grid means it is much easier to play, and much more fo...Full ReviewAs a fan of 2048, I was immediately drawn to 2048 plus as soon as I saw it. I was hoping for a more challenging twist on the game. Unfortunately that is not the case. 2048 Plus has a 6x6 grid instead of 4x4, but is otherwise the same. The larger grid means it is much easier to play, and much more forgiving. My very first game I got the 16384 tile without ever feeling challenged. The fame may get more challenging, but it takes too much time to get to that point.

Too much of a good thing... The idea is great and the customisation options alone are worth playing this game for. The problem, though, is that expanding the playing field of 2048 diminishes the sense of achievement you get when hitting the big numbers. Ultimately the game drags on for far too long (especially in the default m...Full ReviewThe idea is great and the customisation options alone are worth playing this game for. The problem, though, is that expanding the playing field of 2048 diminishes the sense of achievement you get when hitting the big numbers. Ultimately the game drags on for far too long (especially in the default mode). Fans of the original should get some enjoyment from it, but I didn't play it more than once.

You will only play it once It's a great game! Highly addicting and in my opinion, better than the original. The thing is, it's nearly never-ending. You can just keep going and going. I Downloaded it about 3 weeks ago and I'm still on my first game having reached the  16,384 TILE and I'm still going.  Its a game that goes on s...Full ReviewIt's a great game! Highly addicting and in my opinion, better than the original. The thing is, it's nearly never-ending. You can just keep going and going. I Downloaded it about 3 weeks ago and I'm still on my first game having reached the  16,384 TILE and I'm still going.  Its a game that goes on so long that, when you lose, you will more than likely never want to play it again because of all the time you put into it.  That said however, my first (and definetly last) game is very entertaining! Try it!

Good game - 1 suggestion This is a great variation of 2048.  I love the customizable board size. My only suggestion is to make the undo option have the ability to go back more than one swipe.  The board is so large that it requires rapid swipes.  So what often occurs is that you may errant swipe the opposite direction that ...Full ReviewThis is a great variation of 2048.  I love the customizable board size. My only suggestion is to make the undo option have the ability to go back more than one swipe.  The board is so large that it requires rapid swipes.  So what often occurs is that you may errant swipe the opposite direction that you intend then immediately swipe again, essentially ruining your game in a split second. So far for me, every game for me has ended this way. Very frustrating. . Still fun though!

There's so many photo editing apps for Android and I dare to say that this 
is one of the best out there. This app leans towards serious editing 
compared to others. Beginners do not have to worry because there's a video 
tutorial in app to show how to use specific edit. There's of course ads so 
th...Full ReviewThere's so many photo editing apps for Android and I dare to say that this 
is one of the best out there. This app leans towards serious editing 
compared to others. Beginners do not have to worry because there's a video 
tutorial in app to show how to use specific edit. There's of course ads so 
that the developer can earn some income. I bought the VIP and it's really 
worth the price even if you don't edit frequently. To James, continue to 
optimize and add new features in the future update. Looking forward to it.

the in...Full ReviewI don't know a single person who would agree with the terms of service one 
must accept in order to use this app. Logging my device ID, IP address, 
websites I visit etc. Then they want to share this information with 
companies and advertisers as they deem appropriate? I don't give a damn if 
the info you collect personally identifies me or not. This is no different 
than Facebook. They offer you a "service" but the reality is that it's all 
about turning the user into a commodity which they then can exploit for 
profit.

j...Full ReviewBest photo editing app I've ever used! My only complaint would be the

really wish there were more buttons to auto turn the image so that I don't 
have to manually rotate the image, which never comes out even, rather than 
just shape overlays (which, to be honest, are kinda lame). Aside from that, 
brilliant, just the best! I highly recommend this to anyone and everyone, 
professional and amateur alike!

all of my other editing apps. My only suggestions are there should be a 
removal selection, where you can just select the area you want gone and 
pre...Full ReviewI absolutely love this app. It has so many options when editing, a ton of 
filters, stickers etc. Best yet for 90% of my editing, I've deleted almost 
all of my other editing apps. My only suggestions are there should be a 
removal selection, where you can just select the area you want gone and 
presto. Also when it comes to slimming the body, there should be a way to 
manually do it, so you can selwct where and how much you want done because 
the way it is now doesn't work very well, just kinda makes the whole 
picture look thinner, there isnt one which to me is very important. I would 
also love to be able to do a manual when is comes to red eye removal, don't 
really understand how this one works? When I try it leaves a black spot. I 
think there should be more options on lens flare and light leak or at least 
an option to upload more. But all in all it's an amazing app that I will 
always use and I've been telling everyone I know to download it!!

glad I did. It's a keeper.

I do most of photo art work with this AP via my i phone and am pretty active on Flickr. It is the very best.   I just traded up for a Galaxy S9+ and am going wild ;)     With all it's options, adjusting size of photo, mirroring, rotating, (contrast, and brightness where you want it on the photo) blending with various shape options that again you can adjust yourself, it's pretty great.    Text, Filters, color, color effects, they have SO many options than the others.  My new favorite--ad on effects, filters, backgrounds that you can add or erase to suit your art. Photo studio was the only reason I was using vz message plus, it allowed seemles editing and it only took a few clicks to get from inside the messaging app to the photo studio editor and back to the messaging app. One day photo studio was no longer part of Verizon's message+. So I started my quest. I ended up dumping vzmessage+. Back to this app... One great feature in this app is the grid while editing as well as the ability to zoom while adding marks on the picture, or being able to scroll using 2 finger swipe. These seem so basic but I found no other app that did it like photo studio. Other apps do it but it takes more clicks to get around.  The biggest plus is that I now go from my preferred messaging app to photo studio and back to attaching the picture in almost the same amount of clicks as when it was embedded in vz message+. Actually a few more, but this is ok. If you used message plus and you miss photo studio like I did until now. Get photo studio pro well worth the 5 bucks , then  pair it up with Android messages and you will be very happy!!!.  To flow from on to the other include the messaging app album from within photo studio, then you will have direct access to pictures saved to this folder, u will be able to edit and share with a few clicks. !!!  Hope this was helpful;-)!
